page.title: 01HURSLEY AND AMPFIELD
page.content: This twelve square kilometres of rural area includes the two attractive villages of Hursley in the North-East and Ampfield in the South-West.There is also a large forest area-Ampfield Wood on the Western boundary.The remaining land is mainly open farmland The most important landmark in Hursley is the complex of{I.B.M. specialising in the design of {computers;centered in Hursley}Park.IT employs over two thousand people.The house,Hursley Park House,is now the Reception and offices for the Company.By contrast Hursley village is still very small and unspoilt with many attractive Tudor houses. In many parts of Ampfield Wood the soil has bright orange clay just below the topsoil. It is also very sandy and gravelly with flint patches.
